title: Issue with built-in native notification audio effects of apps
content:
Hi,

Many Android apps come with their own notification audio effects, for example the eBay Cha-Ching notification sound when you've sold something.

But on my Pixel 4a 5G, apparently not a single app plays its supplied sound effects, instead all apps are using default audio effects from the notification sound pool provided by the Pixel itself.

This means that I can no longer hear from a distance which app is asking for attention, since everything sounds the same now, which means I have to physically unlock the phone and check notifications.

I can't find a way to activate the app's built-in audio effects. I can assign downloaded sound effects to apps and their different notification types, but that would be very time-consuming and tedious.

My older Android devices do play these distinct notifications sound just fine, so how can I fix this on my new Pixel?

Thanks in advance for any tipps!
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a (5G)
